snippet: Dilkhayot Kasimov, 26, who an F.B.I. official said “served as a money man” in a conspiracy to help another defendant travel to Syria to join the Islamic State, was ordered held without bail.
abstract: Dilkhayot Kasimov, fourth Brooklyn man to be indicted in plot to aid Islamic State, pleads not guilty to charges of conspiracy and attempt to support a terrorist group; prosecutors describe Kasimov as 'money man' who helped raise funds for compatriots to travel to Turkey and join group.
lead_paragraph: Dilkhayot Kasimov, 26, who an F.B.I. official said “served as a money man” in a conspiracy to help another defendant travel to Syria to join the Islamic State, was ordered held without bail.

headline.main: 4th Brooklyn Man Indicted in Plot to Assist ISIS Pleads Not Guilty
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Man Pleads Not Guilty to ISIS Plot

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
